intro: Columnea arguta, commonly known as the silverleaf columnea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright red or orange flowers that are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. Columnea arguta is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental flowers and compact growth form.
